Award Type: DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C)
Description:
TO IMPLEMENT THE TERMS OF THE SOBOBA BAND OF LUISENO INDIANS SETTLEMENT AGREEMENT, APPROVED BY THE U.S. CONGRESS IN THE SOBOBA SETTLEMENT ACT, P.L. 110-297, 122 STAT. 2975 (JULY 31, 2008). 
THE SETTLEMENT, REACHED WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF A FEDERAL INDIAN WATER RIGHTS SETTLEMENT TEAM, RESOLVED THE LITIGATION ENTITLED: SOBOBA BAND OF LUISENO INDIANS V. METROPOLITAN WATER DISTRICT OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA, ET AL., CASE NO. 00-04208 GAF (U.S. DISTRICT COURT, CENTRAL DISTRICT OF CALIFORNIA).

Award Type: DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C)
Description: TO MANAGE CONTINUED AND PLANNED DEVELOPMENT ON THE RESERVATION, THE TRIBE CONTINUES DETAILED LAND USE PLANNING.  WATER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, INCLUDING ASSESSMENT AND QUANTIFICATION OF TRIBAL WATER RESOURCES IS A CRITICAL PART OF THIS PLANNING TO ENSURE THERE IS AN ADEQUATE SUPPLY OF WATER TO SUPPORT THE TRIBE'S CURRENT AND FUTURE NEEDS, AND TO ENSURE APPROPRIATE LEVELS OF DEVELOPMENT SO AS NOT TO UNDULY BURDEN LIMITED TRIBAL TRUST RESOURCES.

Award Type: DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C)
Description: THE CAMPO BAND WILL GATHER ALL DATA NECESSARY FOR THE PURPOSE OF DETERMINING AND ESTABLISHING ITS WATER RIGHTS, INCLUDING NEGOTIATION, ADJUDICATION, OR LITIGATION SO THAT TRIBAL MEMBERS AND THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT WILL BE ABLE TO SECURE ITS INHERENT WATER ALLOCATION ALLOWING THE TRIBE AND ITS MEMBERS TO HAVE AN ADEQUATE WATER SUPPLY, AND WILL ALSO, THROUGH PRUDENT MANAGEMENT, CONSERVE AND PROTECT WATER RESOURCES.

Award Type: DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C)
Description: GROUNDWATER LEVELS WITHIN THE ANZA BASIN HAVE DECLINED SINCE THE 1950'S.  THE CAHUILLA INDIAN RESERVATION IS LOCATED IN A RAPIDLY GROWING AREA OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA.  THE TREND OF OFF-RESERVATION DEVELOPMENT HAS, AND DOES, SHOW INCREASING LEVELS OF IMPACT TO THE TRIBE'S WATER RESOURCES AND PLACES IN RISK THAT WHICH SHOULD BE THEIR FEDERALLY RESERVED WATER RIGHTS.  BECAUSE OF THIS, THE TRIBE IS ENGAGED IN AN ACTIVE PROCESS OF NEGOTIATING/LITIGATING THE SETTLEMENT OF ITS FEDERALLY RESERVED WATER RIGHTS IN THE SANTA MARGARITA RIVER BASIN.  THE U.S. GOVERNMENT IS PRESENTLY PARTICIPATING IN THIS PROCESS.

Award Type: DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C)
Description: WATER RESOURCE PLANNING & PRE-DEVELOPMENT.  THE PROJECT PROPOSES TO ESTIMATE WATER DEMAND AND RESOURCE IMPACTS FROM DEVELOPMENT IN THE ANZA-CAHUILLA BASIN, TO UPDATE WATER USE ESTIMATES, AND TO COMPLETE A GEOPHYSICAL SURVEY AND 2-3 MONITORING WELLS IN THE SOUTHEASTERN PART OF THE RESERVATION. THE PURPOSES OF THESE TASKS ARE TO AID WATER USE PLANNING BY THE TRIBE, TO IMPROVE THE ANNUAL REPORTING OF WATER USE TO THE SANTA MARGARITA RIVER WATERSHED WATERMASTER, TO BETTER UNDERSTAND THE NATURE OF THE GROUNDWATER DIVIDE BETWEEN ANZA AND TERWILLIGER BASINS, AND TO SUPPLEMENT THE GROUNDWATER LEVEL MONITORING NETWORK ESTABLISHED IN 2015.  THE MONITORING NETWORK WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BETTER MANAGE ITS GROUNDWATER RESOURCES AND TO MONITOR THE IMPACTS TO THESE RESOURCES IN CONJUNCTION WITH AND FOLLOWING SETTLEMENT OF THE TRIBE'S WATER RIGHTS CLAIMS.

Award Type: DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C)
Description: USGA JOINT FUNDING AGREEMENT FUNDING FOR THE N. AQUAFER SPRINGS SYNOPTIC SAMPLING PROJECT
